amendments.title: An amendment numbered 10 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase the Federal Highway Administration Emergency Relief Program by $500 million.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Axne amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 9 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase the Emergency Watershed Program by $310 million.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Axne amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 8 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to shorten the time requirement of the publication of rules of the Department of Housing and Urban Development Community Development Fund in Public Law 115-123.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Fletcher amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 393 - 20 (Roll no. 200).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 7 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to limit the matching requirement for the Specialty Crop Research Initiative.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Schrier amendment (A007) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 6 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to prohibit funds in the bill from being used to enforce regulations requiring within two years construction of agency relief projects funded by the Federal Highway Administration.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Huffman amendment (A006) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 168 (Roll no. 199).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase Air Force Operations and Maintenance by $270 million.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Cunningham amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 4 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase the amount of MilCon funding for the Air Force by $300,000,000 and the U.S. Marine Corps and Navy by $385,000,000 to expedite the rebuild of installations affected by 2018 hurricanes.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Dunn amendment (A004) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase funding for waste water treatment plants impacted by Typhoon Yutu by $8,800,000 based on EPA cost estimates for repair and resiliency updated on March 20, 2019.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Sablan amendment (A003) Agreed to by recorded vote: 268 - 143 (Roll no. 198).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 2 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to amend the dollar amount of nutritional assistance for American Samoa from $5,000,000 to $18,000,000.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Radewagen amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 1 printed in Part C of House Report 116-51 to increase funding by $5 million for NOAAs weather forecasting, modeling, and cloud computing programs, including the Earth Prediction Innovation Center.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Perlmutter amendment (A001) Agreed to by recorded vote: 247 - 165 (Roll no. 197).

amendments.title: In the nature of a substitute.
amendments.latest_major_action: Amendment SA 250 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
